CatDescriptText: Bessie Sewell, 1625 Seymour Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 27, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is any racial tension in Pittsburgh? in neighborhood where you live?  If so, what do you think causes it?" answer reads: "No, I haven't seen any, but that is not saying that it isn't happening.  I've only lived here in Pittsburgh for about two years.  Everything was all right in Washington, D.C., where I lived."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bessie Sewell wearing earrings, light colored blouse with bow at collar, cardigan, and dark skirt, standing in front of building with stone and brick wall, bulletin board with photographs and posters on the right, some which read "Never Love a Stranger" and "Read the Book! See the Movie!... Starts Wed. Sept. 17 Stanley Theatre"
